content.description:
Stars Wait With Light ascends a clean arete via deft footwork. The rock quality is premium, and the landing is clear and flat.

Stand start with a high left hand edge and an even higher right hand (I had to tip-toe to reach) sidepull at the arete. From there, work the invisi-feet up, reach a left hand to the horizontal seam, match a right hand next to it, then reach the lip, and mantle atop the block.
content.protection: A pad will work fine, the landing is spectacular.
content.location: It climbs the northeast arete of Bosky Block.

content.description:
Moxie is a straightforward, one move dyno problem that climbs a short, slightly overhung face.

Stand start with hands matched on the high edge. From there, dyno to the lip, traverse left until clear of the block atop, and mantle onto the boulder.
content.protection: A pad should do it, the landing is perfect.
content.location: It climbs the east face of Bosky.

content.description: Stand start with left hand crimp and a right crimp with an eye-like shape. From there, work up and slightly right through the edges to reach a solid topout.
content.protection: Perfect landing, it's both clear and flat, a pad should do it.
content.location: It climbs the north face slab of Bosky.

content.description: Sit start with a sandy left hand sidepull on the large feature and a good right hand sidepull. From there, hit a right hand edge out right, match with the left, dyno to the lip, and top it out.
content.protection: Pad should do it, the landing is great.
content.location: It climbs the southern section of Bosky's east face.
